BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Gliding snow represents the main danger. Fresh wind slabs require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Gliding snow represents the main danger. On steep grassy slopes more gliding avalanches are possible, even large ones in isolated cases. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
On very steep west facing slopes individual medium-sized slab avalanches are possible below approximately 2400 m. This applies even in case of a single winter sport participant.

As a consequence of new snow and a strong wind from westerly directions, wind slabs will form from the middle of the day. The fresh and older wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m, in particular adjacent to ridgelines. Mostly avalanches are small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night was quite good over a wide area. The old snowpack will be moist below approximately 2400 m.

Over a wide area 5 to 10 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 1500 m. This applies in particular in the east. The wind will be moderate to strong.
The fresh wind slabs are bonding well with the old snowpack. They are mostly small and can only be released in isolated cases.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment:
Sunday: The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust. Decrease in danger of wet avalanches.
The weather conditions will facilitate a slight stabilisation of the snow drift accumulations.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of a strong wind from westerly directions, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs will form on Saturday. They can be released by small loads and reach medium size. Such avalanche prone locations are to be found on very steep slopes above approximately 2500 m and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. In particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions these avalanche prone locations are more widespread and the danger is slightly greater. Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised in particular in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.

The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust. As the moisture increases only isolated small and medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible, caution is to be exercised in particular at the base of rock walls, as well as on very steep grassy slopes.
The danger of moist and wet avalanches will decrease during the day. Gliding avalanches are possible however even now. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In the western part of the northern flank of the Alps, along the border between Valais and France 0 to 10 cm of snow will fall on Saturday above approximately 2000 m. In some localities in some localities up to 5 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell on Thursday above approximately 2500 m. The wind was strong at times.
The weather conditions gave rise to moistening of the snowpack over a wide area, this also applies on shady slopes below approximately 2500 m.
In particular shady slopes high altitudes and the high Alpine regions: The upper section of the snowpack is dry; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow.
A lot of snow is lying at intermediate and high altitudes.
Since Thursday small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized avalanches were observed.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Sunday: As the temperature drops a quite favourable avalanche situation will prevail. Strong northwesterly wind.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Natural moist avalanches are possible in isolated cases as before.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust and will soften later than the day before. As a consequence of warming during the day there will be a gradual increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. Thus far only isolated small and medium-sized natural avalanches are possible, caution is to be exercised in particular at the base of rock walls, as well as on extremely steep sunny slopes.
Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be started very early and concluded timely.
Isolated avalanche prone weak layers exist in the snowpack on shady slopes. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in high Alpine regions. Avalanches can be released in the old snowpack, in particular by large additional loads.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack is largely stable and its surface has a melt-freeze crust that is strong in many cases. The high temperatures in the late morning will give rise to rapid moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. In particular shady slopes high altitudes and the high Alpine regions: Towards its surface, the snowpack is dry; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Natural moist avalanches are possible in isolated cases as before.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust and will soften later than the day before. As a consequence of warming during the day there will be a gradual increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. Thus far only isolated small and medium-sized natural avalanches are possible, caution is to be exercised in particular at the base of rock walls, as well as on extremely steep sunny slopes.
Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be started very early and concluded timely.
Isolated avalanche prone weak layers exist in the snowpack on shady slopes. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in high Alpine regions. Avalanches can be released in the old snowpack, in particular by large additional loads.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack is largely stable and its surface has a melt-freeze crust that is strong in many cases. The high temperatures in the late morning will give rise to rapid moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. In particular shady slopes high altitudes and the high Alpine regions: Towards its surface, the snowpack is dry; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Gliding snow represents the main danger. In the course of the day sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs will form at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Gliding snow represents the main danger. On steep grassy slopes more gliding avalanches are possible, even large ones in isolated cases. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

On very steep west facing slopes individual medium-sized slab avalanches are possible below approximately 2400 m. This applies even in case of a single winter sport participant.

As a consequence of new snow and a strong wind from westerly directions, wind slabs will form from the middle of the day. The fresh wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m, in particular adjacent to ridgelines. Mostly avalanches are small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good over a wide area. The old snowpack will be moist below approximately 2400 m.

Over a wide area 5 to 10 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 1500 m. The wind will be moderate to strong.
The fresh wind slabs are lying on soft layers in particular on shady slopes above approximately 2400 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Sunday: The fresh wind slabs remain prone to triggering on shady slopes above approximately 2400 m. More frequent moist loose snow avalanches are to be expected.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Gliding snow represents the main danger. In the course of the day sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs will form at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Gliding snow represents the main danger. On steep grassy slopes more gliding avalanches are possible, even large ones in isolated cases. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

On very steep west facing slopes individual medium-sized slab avalanches are possible below approximately 2400 m. This applies even in case of a single winter sport participant.

As a consequence of new snow and a strong wind from westerly directions, wind slabs will form from the middle of the day. The fresh wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m, in particular adjacent to ridgelines. Mostly avalanches are small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good over a wide area. The old snowpack will be moist below approximately 2400 m.

Over a wide area 5 to 10 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 1500 m. The wind will be moderate to strong.
The fresh wind slabs are lying on soft layers in particular on shady slopes above approximately 2400 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Sunday: The fresh wind slabs remain prone to triggering on shady slopes above approximately 2400 m. More frequent moist loose snow avalanches are to be expected.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The danger of natural moist avalanches will increase during the day. As a consequence of new snow and strong wind the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent towards the evening.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As the moisture increases individual gliding avalanches and moist snow slides are possible. In gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as above the tree line wind slabs will form.
The fresh wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant and generally at high altitude.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust. Moist and wet avalanches are possible as the day progresses, in particular on steep slopes below approximately 2600 m, as well as at the base of rock walls above the tree line. Individual gliding avalanches can also occur.
The wind slabs are to be evaluated with care and prudence in all aspects at high altitude. Caution is to be exercised in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls, as well as in places that are protected from the wind.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The new snow of recent weeks can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2800 m. The solar radiation will give rise as the day progresses to rapid softening of the snowpack over a wide area in all regions especially at low and intermediate altitudes. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack over a wide area.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The snowpack will be moist in the southeast and in the southwest.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The early morning will see favourable conditions generally, but the danger of wet and gliding avalanches will increase later.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights:
A clear night will be followed in the early morning by favourable avalanche conditions mostly, but the danger of wet avalanches will increase later.
As a consequence of sharply falling temperatures and snowfall and the wind, fresh snow drift accumulations will form from the middle of the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In the late morning the likelihood of wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in all regions. Gliding avalanches can also occur.
The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs that are forming over a wide area must be evaluated with care and prudence. This applies in particular in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation. In all aspects medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible. Avalanches can be released, in particular by large loads. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in all aspects.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather conditions in the late morning will give rise to significant moistening of the snowpack.
As a consequence of new snow and wind, wind slabs will form from the middle of the day. The new snow and wind slabs are bonding poorly with the old snowpack in many places. In many places there is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be cold over a wide area.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights:
A clear night will be followed in the early morning by favourable avalanche conditions mostly, but the danger of wet avalanches will increase later.
As a consequence of sharply falling temperatures and snowfall and the wind, fresh snow drift accumulations will form from the middle of the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In the late morning the likelihood of wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in all regions. Gliding avalanches can also occur.
The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs that are forming over a wide area must be evaluated with care and prudence. This applies in particular in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation. In all aspects medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible. Avalanches can be released, in particular by large loads. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in all aspects.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather conditions in the late morning will give rise to significant moistening of the snowpack.
As a consequence of new snow and wind, wind slabs will form from the middle of the day. The new snow and wind slabs are bonding poorly with the old snowpack in many places. In many places there is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be cold over a wide area.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The danger of moist and wet avalanches will increase during the day, reaching danger level 2 (moderate).
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust and will soften later than the day before. As a consequence of warming during the day individual small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2300 m. Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be concluded early.

Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in very isolated cases in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. This applies especially on very steep northwest, north and northeast facing slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The high temperatures from the late morning will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust and will soften during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The danger of moist and wet avalanches will increase during the day, reaching danger level 2 (moderate).
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust and will soften later than the day before. As a consequence of warming during the day individual small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2300 m. Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be concluded early.

Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in very isolated cases in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. This applies especially on very steep northwest, north and northeast facing slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The high temperatures from the late morning will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust and will soften during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The old snowpack will be generally wet all the way through.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The meteorological conditions will foster a gradual weakening of the snowpack as the day progresses.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The old snowpack will be generally wet all the way through.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The meteorological conditions will foster a gradual weakening of the snowpack as the day progresses.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wet snow slides and avalanches are possible in isolated cases. These are small.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Only isolated mostly small wet snow slides and avalanches are possible above approximately 1900 m. In gullies and bowls a sometimes precarious avalanche situation will be encountered in some localities.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Below approximately 1900 m no snow is lying. The older wind slabs are to be found especially in gullies and bowls and at high altitudes. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to gradual and thorough wetting of the old snowpack over a wide area.
